fields.description: Estimates the years of education needed to understand a piece of writing. Higher grade levels mean more complex writing.
Translates the Flesch Reading Ease score into a U.S. school grade level. It indicates the number of years of education generally required to understand the text.
Calculates the understandability of a text. Like the Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level, it approximates the U.S. grade level needed to comprehend the text.
Estimates the years of formal education a person needs to understand the text on the first reading. Higher values indicate material that is harder to read.
